candidates.title: bug: secret local run
candidates.body:
This makes sure secrets are set for local runs. This does, however, assume the use of a shared PG DB and won't work for an RDS PG (see ENG-119)

This closes ENG-120

candidates.title: Refactor/profanity checks
candidates.body:
Fix/refactor based on user feedback on Discord:

> After upgrading shuttle to 0.5.0, I get an error when trying to do anything (deploy, status, local run, etc.). It tells me, that the name I set is an invalid project name. It does only contain lowercase letters, however, it contains the letters "ass" inside the Word ('dachterasse') so it might trigger the profanity check by mistake. Could this be fixed? 

I've removed the Censor::Zealous words as they didn't seem overly terrible in my opinion? I've removed some of the shorter words that might easily be within other words or phrases.

I'm not sure what the below line is/was for, it could be that it's a performance thing and my alternate way isn't ideal for some reason. I'll leave that to someone who knows more than I do on that front! Happy to make the changes though.

```
static INSTANCE: OnceCell<HashSet<String>> = OnceCell::new();
INSTANCE.get_or_init(|| HashSet::from(["Shuttle.rs".to_string()]));
```

candidates.title: chore: dependencies upgrades
candidates.body: Upgrades a bunch of dependencies. Also closes #297

candidates.title: feat: serenity integration
candidates.body:
This PR implements `Service` for `serenity::Client`. This enable Discord bot-developers using Serenity to easily deploy bots with with or without databases. I've added two usage examples, a basic `hello-world` bot and a `todo-list` bot with `shared::Postgres` for persistence.

~~The integration works in it's current state with a valid token, but is a WIP as I am trying to figure out how to write tests for it. It's not straight-forward as the bot listens for commands via web-socket from Discord's servers. A valid discord token is also needed for the bot client to start.~~

Closes #281

candidates.title: feat: implement support for a shared MongoDB database
candidates.body: Implement support for provisioning a shared MongoDB database, with a usage example in the `Poem` integration example.

candidates.title: feat: profanity filter & added "shuttle.rs" to the reserved list of project names
candidates.body: This ensures users aren't using profanity for the names of their shuttle projects. It also creates an easy way to add to the reserved project name list.

candidates.title: feat: deployer load and run
candidates.body:
Makes deployer load and run 'so' files

Fixes ENG-28

repo.name: shuttle
repo.description: Build & ship backends without writing any infrastructure files.
